intro: Hymenidium pilosum, commonly known as the hairy bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibacillaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, bladder-like structures called bladders, which are used to trap small aquatic organisms. The plant is typically found in slow-moving freshwater environments such as ponds and ditches. Its leaves are slender and often bear fine hairs, contributing to its common name. Hymenidium pilosum is a carnivorous plant that relies on these bladders to supplement its nutrient intake in nutrient-poor waters.
